Disease_Description: Fungal disease causing dark, olive-green to black scabby lesions on leaves and fruit. Lesions may have a velvety appearance with fuzzy growth. Severe infections cause premature leaf drop and fruit deformation.
Treatment_Recommendations: FUNGICIDE: Mancozeb 75% WP at 600-800g/acre OR Difenoconazole 25% EC at 100-150ml/acre OR Myclobutanil 10% WP at 80-100g/acre. Apply every 7-10 days during wet periods. CULTURAL: Remove fallen leaves, improve air circulation.

Disease_Description: Fungal disease causing circular, brown to black lesions with concentric rings (bulls-eye pattern) on fruit and leaves. Infected fruit becomes mummified and shriveled, remaining attached to tree.
Treatment_Recommendations: FUNGICIDE: Mancozeb 75% WP at 600-800g/acre OR Tebuconazole 25% EC at 200ml/acre OR Captan 50% WP at 500-750g/acre. Apply preventively every 14 days. CULTURAL: Prune infected branches, remove mummified fruit.

Disease_Description: Fungal disease causing bright yellow-orange spots on upper leaf surface with corresponding cup-shaped structures on lower surface. May cause premature leaf drop and reduced fruit quality.
Treatment_Recommendations: FUNGICIDE: Myclobutanil 10% WP at 80-100g/acre OR Propiconazole 25% EC at 100-150ml/acre OR Sulfur 80% WP at 2-3kg/acre. Apply at bud break and repeat every 10-14 days. CULTURAL: Remove alternate hosts (juniper).

Disease_Description: No disease symptoms present. Leaves are green and healthy with normal growth patterns.
Treatment_Recommendations: PREVENTIVE: Balanced fertilization (NPK 19:19:19 at 5kg/acre), proper pruning for air circulation, avoid overhead watering. Regular monitoring for early disease detection.

Disease_Description: No disease symptoms present. Leaves and berries show healthy blue-green coloration with vigorous growth.
Treatment_Recommendations: PREVENTIVE: Maintain soil pH 4.5-5.5, proper drainage, balanced fertilization. Avoid excessive nitrogen. Monitor for pests and diseases regularly.

Disease_Description: Fungal disease causing white powdery growth on leaves, shoots, and fruit. Infected leaves may curl, distort, and develop reddish discoloration. Fruit may crack or become unmarketable.
Treatment_Recommendations: FUNGICIDE: Sulfur 80% WP at 2-3kg/acre OR Myclobutanil 10% WP at 60-80g/acre OR Potassium bicarbonate 2% spray. Apply every 7-14 days. CULTURAL: Improve air circulation, reduce humidity.

Disease_Description: No disease symptoms present. Leaves are bright green with healthy growth and normal fruit development.
Treatment_Recommendations: PREVENTIVE: Proper pruning, balanced fertilization (NPK 15:15:15 at 3-4kg/acre), adequate spacing for air circulation. Monitor for pest and disease development.

Disease_Description: Fungal disease causing rectangular, gray to tan lesions with dark borders parallel to leaf veins. Lesions may have yellow halos. Severe infections cause significant yield loss.
Treatment_Recommendations: FUNGICIDE: Pyraclostrobin 25% EC at 200ml/acre OR Propiconazole + Pyraclostrobin 400ml/acre OR Azoxystrobin 23% SC at 250ml/acre. Apply at V8-VT stage. CULTURAL: Crop rotation, residue management.

Disease_Description: Fungal disease causing small, circular to oval, reddish-brown pustules (uredinia) scattered over leaf surfaces. Pustules may rupture to release orange spores.
Treatment_Recommendations: FUNGICIDE: Propiconazole 25% EC at 150-200ml/acre OR Tebuconazole 25% EC at 250ml/acre. Apply at first rust appearance and repeat every 14 days. CULTURAL: Plant resistant varieties when available.

Disease_Description: Fungal disease causing elliptical, grayish-green to tan lesions with dark borders on leaves. Lesions may be 1-6 inches long. Severe infections cause premature senescence.
Treatment_Recommendations: FUNGICIDE: Azoxystrobin 23% SC at 250ml/acre OR Pyraclostrobin + Metconazole 500ml/acre. Apply at V8-VT growth stages. CULTURAL: Plant resistant hybrids, crop rotation.

Disease_Description: No disease symptoms present. Leaves are healthy green color with normal growth and ear development.
Treatment_Recommendations: PREVENTIVE: Balanced fertilization, proper plant density (75,000 plants/ha), adequate water management, crop rotation with non-host crops for 2-3 years.

Disease_Description: Fungal disease causing small, circular, brown to black spots on leaves and berries. Infected berries shrivel into hard, black mummies. Causes significant yield losses in wet conditions.
Treatment_Recommendations: FUNGICIDE: Mancozeb 75% WP at 3-4 pounds/acre OR Myclobutanil 40% WSP at 4-5oz/acre OR Ziram 76% DF at 4 pounds/acre. Start at 3-5 inch shoot growth, repeat every 10-14 days through post-bloom.

Disease_Description: Complex fungal disease (esca complex) causing interveinal chlorosis, necrosis, and "tiger stripe" patterns on leaves. Berries may show dark spots and shrivel.
Treatment_Recommendations: FUNGICIDE: Combine systemic and protectant fungicides - Tebuconazole + Mancozeb. No single fungicide provides complete control. CULTURAL: Improve air circulation, reduce stress factors.

Disease_Description: Fungal disease causing angular, brown lesions between leaf veins. Lesions may have yellow halos. Can cause defoliation and reduced vine vigor in severe cases.
Treatment_Recommendations: FUNGICIDE: Copper oxychloride 50% WP at 500-750g/acre OR Mancozeb 75% WP at 600g/acre. Apply every 10-14 days during favorable conditions. CULTURAL: Improve vineyard ventilation.

Disease_Description: No disease symptoms present. Leaves show healthy green coloration with normal growth and fruit development.
Treatment_Recommendations: PREVENTIVE: Balanced nutrition, proper pruning, disease monitoring, avoid overhead irrigation, maintain optimal soil moisture and pH levels.

Disease_Description: Bacterial disease (transmitted by Asian citrus psyllid) causing asymmetrical leaf yellowing, stunted growth, small bitter fruit, and eventual tree death.
Treatment_Recommendations: TREATMENT: No cure available. Remove infected trees immediately. CONTROL VECTOR: Imidacloprid 17.8% SL at 3-5ml/tree for psyllid control. PREVENTIVE: Use certified disease-free nursery stock.

Disease_Description: Bacterial disease causing small, dark, water-soaked spots on leaves, fruit, and twigs. Spots may have yellow halos. Severe infections cause defoliation and fruit cracking.
Treatment_Recommendations: BACTERICIDE: Streptomycin sulfate 17% + Tetracycline 3% at 200-300g/acre OR Copper oxychloride 50% WP at 500-750g/acre. Apply every 7-10 days during favorable conditions. CULTURAL: Prune for air circulation.

Disease_Description: No disease symptoms present. Leaves and fruit show healthy development with normal coloration.
Treatment_Recommendations: PREVENTIVE: Proper nutrition (balanced NPK fertilization), adequate spacing, avoid overhead irrigation, regular pruning for air circulation and light penetration.

Disease_Description: Bacterial disease causing small, dark, raised spots on leaves and fruit. Spots may have yellow halos. Causes fruit blemishing and plant defoliation.
Treatment_Recommendations: BACTERICIDE: Copper oxychloride 50% WP at 500-750g/acre OR Streptomycin sulfate 200ppm. Apply weekly during favorable conditions. CULTURAL: Avoid overhead irrigation, improve plant spacing.

Disease_Description: No disease symptoms present. Leaves are green and healthy with normal fruit development.
Treatment_Recommendations: PREVENTIVE: Crop rotation, balanced fertilization, proper plant spacing, avoid overhead watering, select resistant varieties when available.

Disease_Description: Fungal disease causing brown to black lesions with concentric rings on lower, older leaves. Lesions may have yellow halos. Can cause significant defoliation.
Treatment_Recommendations: FUNGICIDE: Mancozeb 75% WP at 600-800g/acre OR Chlorothalonil 75% WP at 400-500g/acre OR Azoxystrobin 23% SC at 250ml/acre. Apply every 7-10 days starting at disease onset.

Disease_Description: Oomycete disease causing dark, water-soaked lesions on leaves, stems, and tubers. White fuzzy growth may appear on lesion undersides in humid conditions. Highly destructive.
Treatment_Recommendations: FUNGICIDE: Mancozeb 75% WP at 500-700g/acre OR Cymoxanil 8% + Mancozeb 64% at 500g/acre OR Dimethomorph + Mancozeb at 750g/acre. Apply every 7-10 days during favorable conditions.

Disease_Description: No disease symptoms present. Leaves are healthy green with normal tuber development.
Treatment_Recommendations: PREVENTIVE: Plant certified seed potatoes, proper hill formation, balanced fertilization, avoid excessive nitrogen, proper irrigation management.

Disease_Description: No disease symptoms present. Canes and leaves show healthy red coloration with normal berry development.
Treatment_Recommendations: PREVENTIVE: Proper cane management, balanced fertilization, adequate air circulation, winter protection, regular pest monitoring.

Disease_Description: No disease symptoms present. Leaves are healthy green with normal pod development.
Treatment_Recommendations: PREVENTIVE: Proper plant density, balanced nutrition (avoid excessive nitrogen), crop rotation, weed management, regular field monitoring.

Disease_Description: Fungal disease causing white powdery growth on leaves, stems, and fruit. Infected tissues may become distorted and yellowed. Reduces fruit quality and plant vigor.
Treatment_Recommendations: FUNGICIDE: Sulfur 80% WP at 2-3kg/acre OR Potassium bicarbonate 0.5% spray OR Neem oil 2-3ml/liter. Apply at first symptoms and repeat every 7-14 days. CULTURAL: Improve air circulation.

Disease_Description: Fungal disease causing small, dark purple spots on upper leaf surfaces that give leaves a scorched appearance. Infected leaves may turn brown and curl at margins.
Treatment_Recommendations: FUNGICIDE: Copper oxychloride 50% WP at 500g/acre OR Thiophanate methyl 70% WP at 100g/acre. Apply every 10-14 days. CULTURAL: Improve air circulation, avoid overhead watering.

Disease_Description: No disease symptoms present. Leaves are green and healthy with normal runner and fruit development.
Treatment_Recommendations: PREVENTIVE: Plant certified disease-free plants, proper spacing for air circulation, balanced nutrition, drip irrigation instead of overhead watering.

Disease_Description: Bacterial disease causing small, dark, greasy-appearing spots on leaves and fruit. Spots may have yellow halos. Causes fruit unmarketability and defoliation.
Treatment_Recommendations: BACTERICIDE: Copper oxychloride 50% WP at 500-750g/acre OR Streptomycin sulfate 200ppm + Copper sulfate 0.5%. Apply weekly starting early season. CULTURAL: Avoid overhead irrigation.

Disease_Description: Fungal disease causing brown lesions with concentric rings (target spot pattern) starting on lower, older leaves. Yellow halos may surround lesions.
Treatment_Recommendations: FUNGICIDE: Chlorothalonil 75% WP at 400-500g/acre OR Mancozeb 75% WP at 600g/acre OR Azoxystrobin 23% SC at 250ml/acre. Start early season, apply every 10-14 days.

Disease_Description: Oomycete disease causing dark, water-soaked lesions that rapidly expand under humid conditions. White fuzzy growth on lesion undersides. Highly destructive.
Treatment_Recommendations: FUNGICIDE: Mancozeb 75% WP at 500-700g/acre OR Cymoxanil 8% + Mancozeb 64% WP at 500g/acre. Apply every 7-10 days during humid conditions. CULTURAL: Improve greenhouse ventilation.

Disease_Description: Fungal disease causing yellow spots on upper leaf surface with olive-green to brown fuzzy growth on undersides. Thrives in high humidity greenhouse conditions.
Treatment_Recommendations: FUNGICIDE: Azoxystrobin 23% SC at 250ml/acre OR Difenoconazole 25% EC at 100-150ml/acre. Apply in high humidity environments. CULTURAL: Reduce humidity, improve air circulation.

Disease_Description: Fungal disease causing small, circular spots with dark centers and yellow halos on leaves. Severe infections cause defoliation and reduced fruit yield.
Treatment_Recommendations: FUNGICIDE: Chlorothalonil 75% WP at 400-500g/acre OR Mancozeb 75% WP at 600g/acre. Apply every 10-14 days during wet periods. CULTURAL: Avoid overhead watering, improve drainage.

Disease_Description: Arthropod pest causing yellow stippling on leaves from feeding damage. Severe infestations cause bronzing, webbing, and leaf drop. Not a disease but important pest.
Treatment_Recommendations: MITICIDE: Abamectin 1.8% EC at 400-500ml/acre OR Spiromesifen 22.9% SC at 400ml/acre OR Propargite 57% EC at 1-2ml/liter. Apply when threshold is reached (5 mites/leaflet).

Disease_Description: Fungal disease causing brown lesions with distinct concentric rings (target pattern) on leaves and fruit. Can cause significant defoliation and yield loss.
Treatment_Recommendations: FUNGICIDE: Azoxystrobin 23% SC at 250ml/acre OR Pyraclostrobin 25% EC at 200ml/acre OR Chlorothalonil 75% WP at 400-500g/acre. Apply every 10-14 days during favorable conditions.

Disease_Description: Viral disease causing upward leaf curling, yellowing, and stunted growth. Transmitted by whiteflies. Severely reduces fruit production.
Treatment_Recommendations: TREATMENT: No chemical cure available. VECTOR CONTROL: Imidacloprid 17.8% SL at 0.5ml/liter for whitefly control. PREVENTION: Use resistant varieties, remove infected plants, control whiteflies.

Disease_Description: Viral disease causing mosaic patterns, leaf distortion, and plant stunting. No cure available. Spread through mechanical contact, tools, and handling.
Treatment_Recommendations: TREATMENT: No chemical cure available. Remove infected plants immediately. PREVENTION: Use resistant varieties, disinfect tools with 10% bleach solution, avoid mechanical transmission during handling.

Disease_Description: No disease symptoms present. Plants show healthy green foliage with normal fruit development.
Treatment_Recommendations: PREVENTIVE: Balanced fertilization, proper plant spacing, crop rotation, avoid over-watering, select resistant varieties, regular monitoring for pest and disease symptoms.
